intro: Lomatium bicolor var. bicolor, commonly known as the yellow lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in umbels. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and open woodlands. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
